geography_links.text: Indian Early Civilizations, Empires, and World Religions

index.title: Social Studies Curriculum AI Repository
index.raw_text:
Social Studies Curriculum AI Repository













Social Studies Curriculum AI Repository
A comprehensive, machine-readable repository of social studies curriculum data





Overview
Curriculum Data
Data Structure
API Reference
Documentation





Overview
This repository contains structured data extracted from 32 social studies curriculum PDFs, covering geography, regional studies, historical studies, and social studies. The data is organized in a format that is easily parsable by AI systems and web scrapers.


Complete Content
ALL information from the original PDFs is preserved


Structured Format
Well-organized JSON format for easy parsing


Cross-References
Relationships between curriculum elements are explicitly defined


Semantic Search
Find curriculum content semantically related to queries




Curriculum Data
Below is a list of all curriculum units available in this repository. Each unit has its own JSON file containing the complete structured data.

Geography Units

A Geographer's World
The Physical World
The Human World

Regional Studies Units

Canada
Mexico
Central America and the Caribbean
South America
Western Europe
Southern Europe
Eastern Europe
Russia and the Caucasus
North Africa
West and Central Africa
East and Southern Africa
The Arabian Peninsula to Central Asia
The Eastern Mediterranean
The Indian Subcontinent
China, Mongolia, and Taiwan
Japan and the Koreas
Southeast Asia
Oceania and Antarctica
The United States

Historical Studies Units

Early Civilizations of the Fertile Crescent and the Nile Valley
Early Civilizations of China
Early Civilizations of Latin America
Indian Early Civilizations, Empires, and World Religions
World Religions of Southwest Asia
Europe before the 1700s
History of Modern Europe
History of Sub-Saharan Africa

Social Studies Units

Economics
Government and Citizenship



Complete Dataset
You can also access the complete curriculum map that contains all cross-references and relationships:

Complete Curriculum Map (JSON)




Data Structure
Each curriculum unit is represented in a structured JSON format that preserves all content from the original PDFs.
Curriculum Map Structure
{
  "units": [
    {
      "name": "a_geographer_s_world",
      "lessons": ["Studying Geography", "The Branches of Geography", ...],
      "lesson_count": 5,
      "big_ideas": ["The study of geography helps us view the world in new ways", ...],
      "essential_questions": ["How does the use of geographic tools help us view the world in new ways?", ...],
      "key_terms": ["geography", "landscape", "social science", ...]
    },
    ...
  ],
  "lessons": [...],
  "key_terms": {...},
  "big_ideas": [...],
  "essential_questions": [...],
  "content_blocks": [...],
  "cross_references": {...}
}
Unit Structure
{
  "metadata": {...},
  "filename": "a_geographer_s_world",
  "lessons": [...],
  "content": {
    "blocks": {
      "layout": [...],
      "raw": [...]
    },
    "sections": [...],
    "big_ideas": [...],
    "essential_questions": [...],
    "key_terms": {...},
    "teacher_content": [...],
    "student_content": [...],
    "activities": [...],
    "resources": [...],
    "assessments": [...]
  },
  "text_files": {...},
  "images": {...},
  "content_fingerprint": {...}
}


API Reference
This static site provides a simple API for accessing curriculum data:
Endpoints

/data/curriculum_map.json - Complete curriculum map
/data/{unit_name}.json - Individual unit data

Example Usage
// Fetch the curriculum map
fetch('/data/curriculum_map.json')
  .then(response => response.json())
  .then(data => console.log(data));

// Fetch a specific unit
fetch('/data/a_geographer_s_world.json')
  .then(response => response.json())
  .then(data => console.log(data));


Documentation
Detailed documentation is available to help you understand and use the curriculum data:

Data Format Documentation
Extraction Guide
Comparison Guide
User Guide
Troubleshooting Guide
Example Scripts Guide





© 2025 Social Studies Curriculum AI Repository. Available under the MIT License.
This repository is designed to be easily scraped and used by AI systems.
